pr_title: Spark: Print file location in case of error during reads

timeline.message: Spark: Print file location in case of error during reads

timeline.bodyText: Did you intend to set this in the constructor?
timeline.author: rdblue

replies.bodyText: Not really, does it matter if it is in the constructor? It is going to be set to null in the constructor anyway. Similar to the current variable above it.
replies.author: shardulm94

replies.bodyText: Sorry, I missed that this is getting set in next. I thought that change was just to indentation. Nevermind!
replies.author: rdblue

timeline.bodyText:
The main problem I have with this is that it alters the exception by discarding its type. Callers can no longer catch exceptions and handle errors. For example, a caller might catch a SocketException and retry, but let an EOFException propagate.
Is there another way to attach the data? What about logging the file path and exception instead of modifying the exception?
Another option is to create a new exception and attach it as suppressed, then throw the original unmodified.
timeline.author: rdblue

replies.bodyText: Logging the error makes sense! Thanks for the suggestion.
replies.author: shardulm94
